ygData.messageBody:
I need your help to get a message out to the
Everquest community,<br>and try to see that Verant gets a
message that they are acting in a very unfair way to
their players with their new non-moving policy.
I<br>have characters I have worked on since day one that EQ
came out, <br>during a scheduled mover split I moved
them with my guild to another server, then due to Real
Life I was away from the game for about 10 weeks, when
I returned I found my guild had disbanded and most
of my friends no longer were on the server. There
was a policy that if you moved during a server split
and didnt like it you could move back within a small
time frame. Now they say there is a new policy of non
moving unless it is during a server split, so I am stuck
on this server, and if I wish to play on a different
server I need to make new characters that my others
cannot be moved. I built those characters for almost 18
months of my life, I put blood sweat tears and love into
them, yet I do not wish to play them on the TT server,
I want to play eq with my friends on Karana. I know
I am not the only person in this kind of situation,
it s so unfair to have our characters languishing on
a server we dont play on, to have to start all over
from scratch and just leave our beloved characters
rotting where we wont play them! Why should everyone
'have to be' punished by this non moving policy because
afew people are doing illegal things like selling
accounts on Ebay?? People have to register their accounts,
so why not have a non moving policy for non
registered people and only punish the poeple who deserve to
be punished for doing the illegal activites to begin
with? Or if that isnt a solution find one that only
punishes the people who are doing these illegal activites
and not everyone else as well! This policy does not
stop illegal activites all it does is punish people
who have done nothing illegal!<br>If you agree please
email jsmedley@... or call Verant and let them
know! Help me to get this totally unfair policy
changed!<br><br>-Chantria
